info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 13 at 7:09PM PDT by NWS Reno
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact all of the Reno-Sparks area and far southeast parts of Lassen and Plumas counties through 800 PM PDT... At 701 PM PDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Sutcliffe to near Chilcoot. Movement was south at 30 mph. HAZARD...Heavy rainfall, winds in excess of 30 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect thunderstorms with heavy rain, gusty winds and brief small hail to move southward across the greater Reno-Sparks area between 7 and 8 PM, producing ponding on roads and in poor drainage areas. Locations impacted include... All areas in the Reno-Sparks vicinity. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
